How small of a language change does a change get before it becomes too small for an MCP, and we just put in a PR and people checks boxes and then we merge it?

Example: I had an idea just now when looking at AtomicPtrthat we should probably just allow #[repr(align(ptr))] when you want to align your type to the alignment of a pointer, instead of making everyone have three lines of cfg_attr.

Now, repr(align(ptr)) seems like a very small change, but it affects how an attribute works so T-Lang has to sign off somewhere of course. How small is too small for an MCP?

(side note, I did actually also file an MCP issue for this example idea just now, because it's not just an example I think it's genuinely a good idea)
Interesting question. Put it over here: https://github.com/rust-lang/lang-team/issues/35
